Description: Canonical registry defining the closed set of modifier functions for the LOGOS externalization system. Each function qualifies AXIOM output without altering truth value or introducing new assertions.

EPISTEMIC_QUALIFICATION.Definition: Qualifies the rendered output with an explicit epistemic status marker indicating the certainty or knowledge state of the assertion. Driven by Proof/Compile Status and Semantic State Condition classification from the upstream Resolved Output Packet.
EPISTEMIC_QUALIFICATION.Semantic_Constraint: Must not alter the truth value of the target AXIOM. Qualifies certainty of rendering only. The epistemic status is determined upstream; this modifier makes it explicit in the NL surface.
EPISTEMIC_QUALIFICATION.PXL_Anchor: Perfect_self_knowledge: grounded_in p x ‚Üí K x p (PXL_Kernel_Axioms.v)

SCOPE_RESTRICTION.Definition: Narrows the rendered scope of an assertion by making explicit the scope boundaries already determined by the upstream meaning state. Driven by SP-11 (Scope) configuration in the Resolved Output Packet.
SCOPE_RESTRICTION.Semantic_Constraint: Must not alter the truth value or introduce scope not present in the meaning state. Renders existing scope bounds, does not create them.
SCOPE_RESTRICTION.PXL_Anchor: modus_groundens: ‚ñ° (x ‚ßü y) ‚Üí entails x P ‚Üí entails y P (PXL_Kernel_Axioms.v)

TEMPORAL_QUALIFICATION.Definition: Marks the rendered output with a temporal validity reference indicating when the semantic state was resolved. In PXL terms, projects the modal status of the entailment as a temporal frame.
TEMPORAL_QUALIFICATION.Semantic_Constraint: Must not alter truth value. The temporal marker frames when the state was established, not whether it is true. Modal status (necessary vs. contingent) is determined upstream.

STRENGTH_MODULATION.Definition: Adjusts the assertoric force of the rendered output from necessary through provisional to indicated-but-unestablished. Driven by SSC classification: COMPLETE maps to strong assertion, PARTIAL to provisional, UNRESOLVED to indicated.
STRENGTH_MODULATION.Semantic_Constraint: Must not alter truth value. Strength modulation selects among pre-authored surface variants expressing different assertoric force. The underlying entailment is preserved.
STRENGTH_MODULATION.PXL_Anchor: coherence_lifts_entailment: coherence ùïÜ ‚Üí entails x P ‚Üí entails ùïÜ P (PXL_Kernel_Axioms.v)

DEPENDENCY_QUALIFICATION.Definition: Renders explicit dependency conditions on the modified axiom, making visible the dependency relationships already present in the upstream meaning state. Driven by SP-05 (Dependency) configuration.
DEPENDENCY_QUALIFICATION.Semantic_Constraint: Must not alter truth value or introduce dependencies not present in the meaning state. Renders existing dependency relationships, does not create them.
DEPENDENCY_QUALIFICATION.PXL_Anchor: modus_groundens: ‚ñ° (x ‚ßü y) ‚Üí entails x P ‚Üí entails y P; grounding_yields_entails: grounded_in P x ‚Üí entails x P (PXL_Kernel_Axioms.v)

REMEDIATION_ATTACHMENT.Definition: Attaches remediation or resolution guidance to failure-state axioms. Applicable only to primitives representing failed, violated, unsatisfied, or unmet states. Driven by the coherence restoration path available in the meaning state.
REMEDIATION_ATTACHMENT.Applicability_Restriction: Within applicable categories, targets only failure-state primitives: PROOF_FAILED, SCOPE_VIOLATION, DEPENDENCY_UNSATISFIED, PRECONDITIONS_UNMET, CONSTRAINT_VIOLATED, AUDIT_FAILED.
REMEDIATION_ATTACHMENT.Semantic_Constraint: Must not alter the failure state's truth value. Renders a resolution path without claiming resolution has occurred. The remediation is descriptive, not prescriptive.
REMEDIATION_ATTACHMENT.PXL_Anchor: NB_modal_power: ‚ñ° (‚àÄœÜ : Prop, ‚àº (incoherent œÜ) ‚Üí ‚óá (entails ùïÜ œÜ)); privative_collapse: ‚àº (‚óá (entails ùïÜ P)) ‚Üí incoherent P (PXL_Kernel_Axioms.v)

Invariants: Function set is closed and finite
No function may introduce new semantic primitives
No function may alter the truth value of any AXIOM output
No function may stand alone or be compiled without a parent AXIOM
Each function declares exactly the slots it requires; no implicit slot inheritance
Function semantics are qualification-only; they project upstream state, they do not create it
Existing AXIOM registries and templates are not modified by this registry
